How to Clean, Sanitize & Disinfect Water Bottles
Learn how to use Clorox® Bleach to properly clean, sanitize, disinfect and remove mold from stainless steel bottles and plastic water jugs.
More from Clorox experts
Discover more ways to clean.
Use as directed.
When you think of germy places in your home, you probably think of your toilet, your door handles or your phone. But you should include your reusable water bottle on that list – especially if you’re not washing it regularly. Bacteria from our mouths can be deposited inside every time we take a swig, and the outside of the bottle can pick up germs and sweat if you take it with you to the gym or on your commute.
Ideally, you should clean your water bottle with dish soap and hot water every day. But for times you need to go a step further, we’ll show you how to sanitize and disinfect it with bleach.

Steps to sanitize a water bottle
Pre-wash
Wash water bottle with dish detergent and water, then rinse with clean water.
Soak
Soak empty water bottle in a solution of 2 tsp of
Clorox® Disinfecting Bleach with CLOROMAX®
per gallon of water and wait 2 minutes for sanitizing.
Air dry
Drain and allow to air dry. No rinsing is required.
Steps to disinfect a water bottle
Pre-wash
Wash water bottle with dish detergent and water, then rinse.
Soak
Soak empty water bottle in a solution of 1/3 cup
Clorox® Disinfecting Bleach with CLOROMAX®
per gallon of water and wait 6 minutes for disinfecting.
Rinse
Rinse thoroughly with water.
Air dry
Drain and allow to air dry.
If your water bottle has mold inside, follow the disinfecting steps above and increase the soaking time to 10 minutes. Rinse thoroughly and allow to air dry.
Frequently Asked Questions
Can you put water bottles in the dishwasher?
It depends. Check the bottom of your bottle for care instructions or symbols. Some bottles will say “dishwasher safe” or “top rack only,” or you may see a square with plates in the middle, which means it’s safe to wash on the top rack. If you are unsure, it’s best to play it safe and hand wash only to avoid any warping or discoloring of the material.

An important safety message
Bleach and other disinfectants are not suitable for consumption or injection under any circumstances. People should always read the label for proper usage instructions. Disinfecting surfaces with bleach and the disinfecting products is one of the ways to help stop the spread of COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Our products are safe when used as directed. It’s critical that everyone understands the facts in order to keep themselves safe and healthy.
